etymologies: modern Latin, from Greek botrus ‘cluster of grapes’

definitions: a fungus that forms a grayish powdery mold on a variety of organic matter. It causes a number of fungal plant diseases, including chocolate spot, and is deliberately cultivated (as noble rot) on the grapes used for certain wines.

notes.text: Genus Botrytis, phylum Ascomycota: numerous species, in particular the gray mold B. cinerea

shortDefinitions: greyish powdery mould which causes several plant diseases
